metadata.title: CVE-2021-47253 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/amd/display: Fix potential memory leak in DMUB hw_init [Why] On resumewe perform DMUB hw_init which allocates memory:dm_resume->dm_dmub_hw_init->dc_dmub_srv_create->kzalloc That results inmemory leak in suspend/resume scenarios. [How] Allocate memory for the DCwrapper to DMUB only if it was not allocated before. No need to reallocateit on suspend/resume.
